alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 10:33PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WEST BATON ROUGE, SOUTHERN ST. HELENA, NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON, SOUTHEASTERN EAST FELICIANA, EAST CENTRAL IBERVILLE AND EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1033 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brusly, or near Port Allen, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, Livingston, Montpelier, Westminster, Watson, Pride, Shenandoah, Greenwell Spring, Old Jefferson, and Merrydale. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 146 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge
